00023 GenericBuffer::GenericBuffer ()
00024 {
00025     pull_channel = 0;
00026     push_channel = 0;
00027 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::GenericBuffer  ----- */

00033 void
00034 GenericBuffer::push ( Flit* f )
00035 {
00036     buffers[push_channel].push(f);
00037     return;
00038 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::push  ----- */
00039 
00040 Flit*
00041 GenericBuffer::pull ()
00042 {
00043     if( pull_channel > buffers.size() || buffers[pull_channel].size() == 0)
00044     {
00045         fprintf( stdout, "\nERROR: Invalid pull channel pull_ch:%d  no_of_ch:%d buff_occ:%d",
00046                  pull_channel, buffers.size(),buffers[pull_channel].size());
00047         exit(1);
00048     }
00049     Flit* f = buffers[pull_channel].front();
00050     buffers[pull_channel].pop();
00051     return f;
00052 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::pull  ----- */
00053 
00054 Flit*
00055 GenericBuffer::peek ()
00056 {
00057     if( pull_channel > buffers.size() || buffers[pull_channel].size() == 0)
00058     {
00059         fprintf( stdout, "\nERROR: **Invalid pull channel");
00060         exit(1);
00061     }
00062     Flit* f = buffers[pull_channel].front();
00063     return f;
00064 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::pull  ----- */
00065 
00066 uint
00067 GenericBuffer::get_occupancy ( uint ch ) const
00068 {
00069     return buffers[ch].size();
00070 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::get_occupancy  ----- */
00071 
00072 void
00073 GenericBuffer::resize( uint v, uint bs )
00074 {
00075     /* 
00076     for ( uint i = vcs; i<buffers.size(); i++ )
00077         while( !buffers[i].empty())
00078         {
00079             delete buffers[i].front();
00080             buffers[i].pop();
00081         }
00082      * */

00086     return;
00087 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::change_vcs  ----- */

00089 uint
00090 GenericBuffer::get_no_vcs() const
00091 {
00092     /*  should be return the pvt variable but for now using this to ensure
00093      *  init was right and not accessing member variable. */

00098 GenericBuffer::change_pull_channel ( uint ch )
00099 {

00101     pull_channel = ch;
00102     return;

00125 bool
00126 GenericBuffer::is_channel_full ( uint ch ) const
00127 {
00128     /* this is the buffer size that the router is configured for the implementation allow for a bigger buffer[i].size which is the simulation artifact and not the buffer size in the physical router */
00129     return buffers[ch].size() >= BUFFER_SIZE;  
00130 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::full  ----- */
00131 
00132 bool
00133 GenericBuffer::is_empty (uint ch ) const
00134 {
00135     return buffers[ch].empty();
00136 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::empty  ----- */
00137 
00138 string
00139 GenericBuffer::toString () const
00140 {
00141     stringstream str;
00142     str << "GenericBuffer"
00143         << "\t buffer_size: " << buffer_size
00144         << "\t No of buffers: " << buffers.size() << "\n";
00145     for( uint i=0; i<buffers.size() && !buffers[i].empty(); i++)
00146             str << buffers[i].front()->toString();
00147     return str.str();
00148 }               /* -----  end of function GenericBuffer::toString  ----- */
